turns.speaker: MAXWELL
turns.text: After that we go no more!

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Hiya Maxwell.

turns.speaker: MAXWELL
turns.text: I won't say good luck, Walter.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Why not?

turns.speaker: MAXWELL
turns.text: It would imply you could not succeed on your ability alone!

turns.speaker: MAXWELL
turns.text: Why on Earth should you be so depressed?  Have you heard some of the things they've been saying? You can make fifty thousand on these pieces alone!

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: I thought you didn't respect money!

turns.speaker: MAXWELL
turns.text: I don't!  But fifty thou?  That's not money, that's manna!

turns.speaker: MAYOLIA
turns.text: I get it Walter.  I get it.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: What do you get?

turns.speaker: MAYOLIA
turns.text: Your work, the layers of irony.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Hello Mayolia.

turns.speaker: MAYOLIA
turns.text: Walter, you did something to me with your work tonight.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: With Dead Cat?

turns.speaker: MAYOLIA
turns.text: With Dead Cat.  Like a breath of fresh air.  I could just - babble on about it for hours.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Really?

turns.speaker: MAYOLIA
turns.text: It's like...you've turned on.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: T-turned on?

turns.speaker: MAYOLIA
turns.text: A hot light bulb is burning inside of you.  I want to be warmed by it.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: That's really nice of you Mayolia.

turns.speaker: MAYOLIA
turns.text: Let me into your world Walter... let me into that white hot inspired world.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: I can't.  I gotta go home.

turns.speaker: MAYOLIA
turns.text: Well, I'll go home with you.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Oh no, I couldn't do that.  Mrs. Swicker would start asking questions. She's my landlady.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: I don't think so Mayolia.

turns.speaker: MAYOLIA
turns.text: I want to be part of it, I want to inspire you, I want to do - something!

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: You don't have to do anything!

turns.speaker: MAYOLIA
turns.text: Then let me give you something then...

turns.speaker: MAYOLIA
turns.text: I want you to have it.  There's a little something for you in here...

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Gee.  Thanks.

turns.speaker: MAYOLIA
turns.text: Let it inspire you.  Maybe it will let you think of me.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Oh, hello Mrs. Swicker.

turns.speaker: MRS. SWICKER
turns.text: Hello Walter.  I want to tell you the super fixed the leaky pipes and sealed up that hole in your wall.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Oh, OK.

turns.speaker: MRS. SWICKER
turns.text: Walter you look awful pale! What did you have to eat today?

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: I had a salami sandwich, Mrs. Swicker.

turns.speaker: MRS. SWICKER
turns.text: If you were my son...why don't you let me fix you a nice hot bowl of soup, it won't take but a minute.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Oh no, that's OK, I can fix myself something.  Besides, I got something important to do...

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Uh, no, I didn't see him at all.

turns.speaker: MRS. SWICKER
turns.text: What's got into that cat?  Well if you do see him, tell him I've got a nice fat piece of ocean-fresh halibut for him -

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: T-tell him that?

turns.speaker: MRS. SWICKER
turns.text: If you see him.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: OK Mrs. Swicker.

turns.speaker: MRS. SWICKER
turns.text: Good night Walter...

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Good night, Mrs. Swicker -

turns.speaker: MRS. SWICKER
turns.text: What's all the noise in here!

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Noise Mrs. Swicker?  What noise?

turns.speaker: MRS. SWICKER
turns.text: Don't tell me I didn't hear a racket!  I'm an older woman and I don't need to be upset and disturbed in this manner!

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: I was just straightening up the place.

turns.speaker: MRS. SWICKER
turns.text: Straightening up indeed!  Are you sure you're not alone?

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: I'm always alone, Mrs. Swicker, you know that.

turns.speaker: MRS. SWICKER
turns.text: Walter have you been talking to yourself again?

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Well yes I guess I have been Mrs. Swicker.  Somebody's got to.

turns.speaker: MRS. SWICKER
turns.text: She doesn't have to be pretty... just as long as she takes good care of you...

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Uh, I can take real good care of myself, Mrs. Swicker!

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Uh, Mrs. Swicker I got to meet some friends later, and I have to take a shower!

turns.speaker: MRS. SWICKER
turns.text: Well why don't you clean up this dump!

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: I will - good night Mrs. Swicker!

turns.speaker: MRS. SWICKER
turns.text: What's the matter with you!

turns.speaker: AMILYN
turns.text: I don't think this is gold.

turns.speaker: LOTHOS
turns.text: Not as single-minded as the others, not as sybaritic.  Almost thoughtful. She's useless.

turns.speaker: LOTHOS
turns.text: What's wrong with you!?!

turns.speaker: AMILYN
turns.text: My arm!  He took my fucking arm!

turns.speaker: LOTHOS
turns.text: Shut up!  You let him have it!

turns.speaker: LOTHOS
turns.text: You reckless imbecile.  This place is ours for the taking and you let yourself... twelve hundred years old and you act like a child.

turns.speaker: AMILYN
turns.text: I had him in my grasp.

turns.speaker: LOTHOS
turns.text: Cheer up.  You may still.

turns.speaker: AMILYN
turns.text: I look horrible.

turns.speaker: LOTHOS
turns.text: The other two -- the new ones. Where are they?

turns.speaker: AMILYN
turns.text: I don't know.  But the boy, he couldn't kill them.

turns.speaker: LOTHOS
turns.text: No... Not a boy...  Find out if they're dead.  And do something about that arm.  Honestly, I don't know how you made it through the Crusades.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: I like it.  Can I be your friend?

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Stay away from my thang.  Sorry, honey.  'Thing.'

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Well, um... litter?

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Litter, yeah!

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: ... And they're having some memorial service or something tomorrow.  You going?

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: I don't know.  Coach said I had to work on my 'ab's.'

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Coach knows what abs are?

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Whoa!  Whoa!  I'm sorry.  I'm sorry. I don't actually need any right now.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: What's with you?

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Nice to feel needed.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Let's move out!

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Yes!

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: Nice game.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Jeffrey, I don't mean to sound sexist or anything, but can I borrow her?

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: Andy!

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Man has a complex.

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: He's got a...  What do you call it? A Napoleonic Code.

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: Don't grab me, okay?

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Absolutely.  I see now the error of my mistake.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Buffy!  Looking tasty.

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: Thanks.  Have you seen Jeffrey?

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Buffy, this is crazy.  What do these guys want?

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: Andy, start breaking up some chairs. You'll need weapons.

turns.speaker: PIKE
turns.text: Booo!

turns.speaker: BENNY
turns.text: Suck!

turns.speaker: PIKE
turns.text: Wrong answer!  No prize.

turns.speaker: PIKE
turns.text: No, we didn't.

turns.speaker: BENNY
turns.text: Oh, yeah.  But I still want to know what happens.

turns.speaker: PIKE
turns.text: Come on, come on, fork up the scub.

turns.speaker: BENNY
turns.text: That's it, man.  That's the whole story.

turns.speaker: PIKE
turns.text: We're looking at a dog, possible coffee...

turns.speaker: PIKE
turns.text: It's coffee.

turns.speaker: BENNY
turns.text: Amazing!

turns.speaker: BENNY
turns.text: Figures.

turns.speaker: PIKE
turns.text: Do people ever call you 'Buffy the Buffalo?'  I'm just wondering.

turns.speaker: BENNY
turns.text: You're the guys from the movie!

turns.speaker: PIKE
turns.text: We hate you guys!

turns.speaker: BENNY
turns.text: Hey!  She wasted my dog!

turns.speaker: PIKE
turns.text: Bummer metaphor.

turns.speaker: BENNY
turns.text: Rich bitches.  They're a plague. They've gotta be stopped.

turns.speaker: PIKE
turns.text: You didn't like them.

turns.speaker: BENNY
turns.text: They're all the same!  They're so stuck up, they're just... they're not even human.  I hate them.

turns.speaker: PIKE
turns.text: Would you sleep with them?

turns.speaker: BENNY
turns.text: Yes.  Definitely.  Definitely. Please, God.

turns.speaker: PIKE
turns.text: Well, there it is, isn't it?  You don't even like them, and you'd sleep with them.  What's that all about?

turns.speaker: BENNY
turns.text: I got a news flash, man, another shot of this and I'll have sex with you.

turns.speaker: PIKE
turns.text: Oh, yeah, and then you'll never call me.

turns.speaker: BENNY
turns.text: When you get your car together, man, let's bail.

turns.speaker: PIKE
turns.text: You think?  Split?

turns.speaker: BENNY
turns.text: Utterly.  Let's bail this town. It's getting... I don't know.  Let's go somewhere where there aren't any rich bitches.

turns.speaker: PIKE
turns.text: Our own world, where we could live and grow beans.  Hundreds of beans.

turns.speaker: PIKE
turns.text: Benny, man, where you been?  You bailed on me, I passed out, man, I almost did a Jimi Hendrix!

turns.speaker: BENNY
turns.text: Let me in.

turns.speaker: PIKE
turns.text: Hey, I'm trying, but this window is burnt --

turns.speaker: BENNY
turns.text: Invite me in, Pike.

turns.speaker: PIKE
turns.text: Wait a minute.  What's wrong with you, man?

turns.speaker: BENNY
turns.text: I'm fine.

turns.speaker: PIKE
turns.text: You look like shit, Benny.

turns.speaker: BENNY
turns.text: I... feel.... pretty.

turns.speaker: PIKE
turns.text: No offense, man, but I think you're on something nasty.  Why don't you just go and cool out and I'll see you in the morning or something.

turns.speaker: BENNY
turns.text: The sun!  It burns!  It burns!

turns.speaker: BENNY
turns.text: Let me in, Pike!  I'm hungry!

turns.speaker: PIKE
turns.text: Get away from here.

turns.speaker: BENNY
turns.text: I'm hungry.

turns.speaker: PIKE
turns.text: I mean it.

turns.speaker: MERRICK
turns.text: Did you see a girl come by here?

turns.speaker: BIKER
turns.text: You don't mean, like, a cheerleader?

turns.speaker: MERRICK
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: BIKER
turns.text: Yeah, I saw her.  Bitch took my wheels.

turns.speaker: MERRICK
turns.text: Wheels?

turns.speaker: BIKER
turns.text: My bike!  She's a lesbian, too. She told me.

turns.speaker: MERRICK
turns.text: Which way did she go?

turns.speaker: BIKER
turns.text: Down there.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Excellent.

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: What's playing there?

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Your parents are always going away for the weekend.  You're so lucky.

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: Yeah, I guess.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: My mom doesn't go anywhere.  She even does the shopping network. I'm gonna die a virgin.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Oh, my God.  Is that true?

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: Probably.  What movie is this?

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Are there any good sicknesses that aren't too depressing?

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: Guys.  The environment.  I'm telling you, it's totally key.  The earth is in terrible shape, we could al die, and besides, Sting's doing it.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Hey, I was thinking, for the dance, what about a big sign that says 'Don't Tread On Me'.  You know, and a picture of the earth.

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: Don't tread on the earth?

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: Dying.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Eeyuu.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Hi, Buffy.

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: Hi, guys.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: He doesn't look fifty.

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: Guys.  Guys!  Reality pulled out of her five minutes ago.

turns.speaker: BUFFY'S MOM
turns.text: Do you know what time it is?

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: Uum... around ten?

turns.speaker: BUFFY'S MOM
turns.text: Buffy, honey?

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: Yeah?

turns.speaker: BUFFY'S MOM
turns.text: Have you gained a few pounds?  Maybe it's that outfit...

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: Maybe.

turns.speaker: BUFFY'S MOM
turns.text: What's Bobby gonna say?

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: I don't know, Mom; I've never met Bobby.

turns.speaker: BUFFY'S MOM
turns.text: Aren't we the chatty ones.  Kiss noise.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: You okay?

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: I... yeah, I'm okay.  I'm fine.

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: Well... it's possible they think my name's Bobby.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Real 'quality-timers,' Hugh.

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: Something like that.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Hey, it works for me.  If they want to leave you alone in the house, all helpless and vulnerable...

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: What show is this?

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: It's the news, Buffy.

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: Oh.  Who's in it?  I know what it is.  It's what's on instead of the movie.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: I just want to see the basketball scores.  It's important.

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: Mmmnkay.

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: Oh, wow.  Oh, wow.  Oh, wow.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: You were having a nightmare.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: What'd you dream about?

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: Nothing.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Come on, what was it?

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: Nothing.  It was just a dream.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Hey there.

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: Hi.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Are you going out with Jeffrey tonight?

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: Jealous?

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Hey, baby, how ya doing?  You look beat.

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: I do?  I guess I do.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Where were you last night?  I called your house like four times.

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: I went to sleep.  I think I have the flu or something.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: I can't get sick.  You know -- training and all.  I'm gonna be late.

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: 'Bye.

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: I can take care of myself, Jeffrey.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: So I noticed.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: So that's your tutor, huh?  What is he, like, your boyfriend now?

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: Jeffrey.  Projectile vomit.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Buffy, what are you doing here?

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: I thought we were meeting here.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: I'm here with Jenny.

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: I don't understand.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Oh, come on, Buffy.  You know what's going on.  It's not working out at all.  I've got to move on.  I mean, I've got needs, too.  I told you about all this.

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: No, you didn't.  When?

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Didn't you get my message?

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: You broke up with my machine?

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: You weren't home.  Like always.

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: You left me a message?

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: I'm out of here.  Jenny.

turns.speaker: LOTHOS
turns.text: Ah, my fool is dead.  He was careless, always.  Still, I'll pull out your tongue for that.  Don't you understand?  I've killed you a dozen times.  Your life is not a blink of my eye, not a single breath.  I have lived in the shadows, in the pulsing filth behind men's eyes.  A thousand years, and more. I have conversed with the worms that fed on my corpse and I have bathed in the blood of emperors.

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: Have you ever thrown up in the front row of a Richard Marx concert?

turns.speaker: LOTHOS
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: LOTHOS
turns.text: You're even weaker than the others.

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: I think you've forgotten something.

turns.speaker: LOTHOS
turns.text: This?  This is you only weapon? Your puny faith?

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: No...

turns.speaker: LOTHOS
turns.text: I am a God!  A God!

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: I am so sure.

turns.speaker: PIKE
turns.text: Will you guys shut up, please?

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: It could happen.

turns.speaker: PIKE
turns.text: Can we have a hot dog, please, medium rare, and a cup of joe?

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: You guys are thrashed.

turns.speaker: PIKE
turns.text: Yeah, we're drunk.  We're the Drunks. What's your name?

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: Buffy.

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: Hi.

turns.speaker: PIKE
turns.text: Hi there.

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: Is that your car?

turns.speaker: PIKE
turns.text: It was.  I think it's pretty much ready for the --

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: How are you doing?

turns.speaker: PIKE
turns.text: Oh, I'm good.  I'm good.  Kind of miss my knees, though.

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: You want some water or something?

turns.speaker: PIKE
turns.text: Water.  Okay.

turns.speaker: PIKE
turns.text: Do you do this kind of thing a lot? I mean, is this like a hobby?

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: Not exactly.

turns.speaker: PIKE
turns.text: They were vampires, weren't they?

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: PIKE
turns.text: God!  Unbelievable.  Vampires.

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: You had a car full of stuff.  Were you leaving?

turns.speaker: PIKE
turns.text: Yeah, I was bailing.  I have a friend, and he's really... well, he's really vampire, I guess.  Bad scene.

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: Well, stay here tonight.

turns.speaker: PIKE
turns.text: Thanks.  Tomorrow morning, I'm on a bus.  I'm gone.

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: Where are you gonna go?

turns.speaker: PIKE
turns.text: Well, I've always wanted to see Oxnard.

turns.speaker: PIKE
turns.text: Hey, jeez are you okay?  You need a hand?

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: It's nothing.  It doesn't hurt.

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: Things are kind of confusing.

turns.speaker: PIKE
turns.text: I'll back that up.

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: Three weeks ago all I thought about was... well, I didn't actually think about anything.  I definitely didn't expect this.

turns.speaker: PIKE
turns.text: I know.  My guidance counselor never mentioned anything about vampires. 'Prison' came up a few times, but nothing about undead.

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: It's weird.  I went back to my old grade school once, to the playground -- I used to hang out there all the time, playing on the swings and stuff... I went back and it was so tiny, the whole place.  I couldn't even fit on the swings.  Everything just looked so small.  I'm sorry.  I'm babbling.

turns.speaker: PIKE
turns.text: No, you're not.

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: I'm kinda beat.  You can stay in my mom's room if you want.

turns.speaker: PIKE
turns.text: I think I'll just hang out here. Make sure the sun comes up and everything.

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: You sure?

turns.speaker: PIKE
turns.text: Oh, I'll be fine.  Got my chair, got my window, I'm great.

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: Mmkay.

turns.speaker: PIKE
turns.text: Hey, Buffy...

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: Yeah?

turns.speaker: PIKE
turns.text: You know, you saved my life.  And I just wanted to say... I forgive you for talking during the movie. Almost.

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: I didn't expect to see you.

turns.speaker: PIKE
turns.text: I know.

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: Why'd you come back?

turns.speaker: PIKE
turns.text: I don't know.  I kind of thought I ought to be here.  You know, this isn't exactly the kind of thing you can run away from.

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: Thanks.

turns.speaker: PIKE
turns.text: Besides, Oxnard sucks.

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: Pike, I don't think you're up to this.

turns.speaker: PIKE
turns.text: I think I could help.  You gonna tell me you don't need help?

turns.speaker: PIKE
turns.text: Buffy?  What's wrong?

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: Oh, God.  It's him.  I think it's him.

turns.speaker: PIKE
turns.text: Who?

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: Merrick...

turns.speaker: PIKE
turns.text: I been working on some stuff for you.  What'cha doing?

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: I'm going shopping.  Don't try to stop me.

turns.speaker: PIKE
turns.text: Cool.  I could actually use a couple of Allen wrenches.  What do you need?

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: A dress.

turns.speaker: PIKE
turns.text: Dress, huh?  What for?

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: For the dance.

turns.speaker: PIKE
turns.text: Come again?

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: I'm going to the senior dance.

turns.speaker: PIKE
turns.text: Second word... sound like 'dance'.

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: I'm going to the dance.

turns.speaker: PIKE
turns.text: What for?

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: In order to dance and to drink punch and to be with my friends. Comprende?

turns.speaker: PIKE
turns.text: I don't believe this.  The world's under attack by the legions of the undead and you're going to a mixer?

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: It's not a mixer.  It's the senior dance.  And it's important.  You wouldn't understand.

turns.speaker: PIKE
turns.text: You got that right.  I thought you wanted to kill vampires.

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: I don't want to kill anybody, and I don't want to talk about it anymore.

turns.speaker: PIKE
turns.text: Listen, I know you're bummed about your friend, and I'm really sorry...

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: He did what he was supposed to.

turns.speaker: PIKE
turns.text: But, Buffy, you're the guy, the chosen guy.

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: Right.  I'm the chosen one.  And I choose to be shopping.

turns.speaker: PIKE
turns.text: I should have known.

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: Leave me alone.

turns.speaker: PIKE
turns.text: Benny was right.  You guys are all exactly the same.

turns.speaker: PIKE
turns.text: I crashed your party.

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: Pretty shallow of you.

turns.speaker: PIKE
turns.text: That's me.

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: I'm glad you came.

turns.speaker: PIKE
turns.text: Yeah, you look like you're having a swell time.

turns.speaker: PIKE
turns.text: Will I get the shit kicked out of me if I ask you to dance?

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: I don't actually think Jeffrey's gonna notice.

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: I'm going out the front.

turns.speaker: PIKE
turns.text: Are you nuts, Buffy?  There's a hundred of them out there.  They'll rip us apart.

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: You're staying here.  Some of them might not come after me.  If they don't this place is gonna turn into a total stain.

turns.speaker: PIKE
turns.text: You say that like it's a bad thing.

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: Good thing one of us was prepared.

turns.speaker: PIKE
turns.text: Buffy, there's no way you're going out there alone.

turns.speaker: PIKE
turns.text: Are you okay?

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: Get away from me!

turns.speaker: PIKE
turns.text: I didn't say it was a bad idea, I just said the timing was off.  We could maybe wait till later.

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: Don't be such a fraidy-cat.

turns.speaker: PIKE
turns.text: Who's afraid?  Besides me, I mean.

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: We've come all this way.  We just have to check it out.  I got a hunch.

turns.speaker: PIKE
turns.text: You're the boss, boss.  I just thought maybe we should wait.

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: It has to be, like a socially conscious theme.

turns.speaker: CASSANDRA
turns.text: 'One that reflects the students' growing awareness of and involvement in the world around them.'

turns.speaker: CASSANDRA
turns.text: It is a pretty crucial subject.

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: See, Cassandra likes it.  Cassandra's my friend.

turns.speaker: BUFFY
turns.text: Bugs.

turns.speaker: CASSANDRA
turns.text: Okay, guys, how about the ozone layer?
